summary: People call me a trooper. I have founded two successful companies while connecting people and organizations across three continents. To achieve this success, I have maintained caring for people as a core of value and incentive. Whether I have connected teachers with suitable positions or advised students to help them find the best schools, my work helps others reach their goals.

awards.title: As an industry leader from KpopStarz.com
awards.description: It was part of their project, Kpop through the eyes of industry leaders interviewing chosen industry leaders.

awards.title: Google.com
awards.description: www.teach-english-korea.com is listed on the 1st page on Google.com with most common keyword in this industry 'teach english in Korea'.

awards.title: Naver
awards.description: www.ivyprep.kr is listed 1st page on www.naver.com with a targeted keyword 'Ivy League college consulting'.

awards.title: Lonely Planet Korea Online & Printed Version
awards.description: www.planetesl.com is listed in working in Korea section as a recommended website to find resourceful information about finding jobs in Korea on Lonely Planet Korea. I remember the day I went to a book store and saw my website in the book. I felt so proud and overcame all the prejudice from Korean society that I don't work for Samsung literally.

awards.title: Google Korea
awards.description: www.planetesl.com is listed on the 1st page of Google Korea, www.google.co.kr with most common keyword 'teach English in Korea'.

projects.title: International Exhibition Coordinator for COEX Conventions
projects.description:
Ensured the success of international energy exhibition in Korea for 100 overseas corporations through effective project management and liaising on all aspects of design, budget, and  construction of trade show booths

Contributed to successful food exhibition in Australia for 20 Korean corporations through development of marketing plans and coordination of design, budget and construction of trade show booths

profile_positions.description:
Helping adults find jobs helped me realize how experiences during adolescence can change the direction of a person’s life. I jumped into this business without hesitation when I met a renowned college consultant, Megan Smith. 

Targeting Korean students and parents for top college consulting, I direct outreach to premium clients by. Some of my accomplishments include:

- Develop college consulting and SAT class service packages for premium clients by researching and identifying customer’s key demand 

- Create and strategize marketing content and materials across website, blogs, newsletters, and brochures

- Counsel students and parents to meet their goals, build and set achievable strategy in all components for excellent college applications

- Placed 1st page rank on Naver.com (Korean major search engine) using the keyword search, “Ivy league university application”

- Develop a network of partner SAT institutes, students, and parents and distribute IvyPrep regularly via website, social media, newsletters, and workshops
profile_positions.title: Director of Sales and Marketing

profile_positions.location: Recruiting ESL teachers around the world
profile_positions.description:
I started this business when I was 23 after receiving support, encouragement, and trust in my abilities from clients freelance recruiting.

Key abilities:

- Develop multi-channel marketing approaches to recruit over 10,000 applicants per year to S. Korea from U.S., Canada, NZ, Australia and England 

- Building relationships among clients-- young teachers coming to Korea first time, school owners, business managers, and government officials across Ministry of Education, Samsung, Hyundai, public and private schools

- Mediate conflicts between employees and employers, finding solutions and resolving conflicts

- Timed project management for recruiting 1 to 200 teachers within the time limit of 1 week to 1 month

- Produce and present key qualities to obtain contracts from a network of 300+ schools, language institutes, companies, Korean government education programs

- Research online marketing trends targeting early 20s, analyzing, developing and implementing strategies

- Write content including vast resources on working and living in Korea

- Research, develop, and implement organic Google SEO strategy
profile_positions.title: Founder & Director

profile_positions.description: Besides PlanetESL.com, I have worked to provide insight to English-speakers from the perspective of a Korean in Korea. Plenty of websites provide information from the perspective of Westerners looking at Korea, but I have produced the less accessible information of an English-speaking Korean person’s perspectives. For example, I have blogged about the top 10 things to do in Korea for LGBT people and how to understand and accept cultural differences such as a strong social hierarchy.
profile_positions.title: Blogger & Content Writer
